column4: In ubuntu when you try to install something from a outside repo you need to give the public key which helps the package manager to verify that this software is legitimate
If you're trying to use something from launchpad you can get the instructions how to insert the in to your synaptic package manager
If you're using Lucid sudo add-apt-repository <ppa:uer/ppa-name> that last part is available at the software makers page in launchpad
oh and the key is known as"Signing key"
